resources.string: Article_Detail_Transition
Details

"Material is the metaphor.

"
"A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion." "The material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet " "technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic.
" "Surfaces and edges of the material provide visual cues that are grounded in reality. The " "use of familiar tactile attributes helps users quickly understand affordances. Yet the " "flexibility of the material creates new affordances that supercede those in the physical " "world, without breaking the rules of physics.
" "The fundamentals of light, surface, and movement are key to conveying how objects move, " "interact, and exist in space and in relation to each other. Realistic lighting shows " "seams, divides space, and indicates moving parts.

"
"Bold, graphic, intentional.

"
"The foundational elements of print based design typography, grids, space, scale, color, " "and use of imagery guide visual treatments. These elements do far more than please the " "eye. They create hierarchy, meaning, and focus. Deliberate color choices, edge to edge " "imagery, large scale typography, and intentional white space create a bold and graphic " "interface that immerse the user in the experience.
" "An emphasis on user actions makes core functionality immediately apparent and provides " "waypoints for the user.

"
"Motion provides meaning.

"
"Motion respects and reinforces the user as the prime mover. Primary user actions are " "inflection points that initiate motion, transforming the whole design.
" "All action takes place in a single environment. Objects are presented to the user without " "breaking the continuity of experience even as they transform and reorganize.
" "Motion is meaningful and appropriate, serving to focus attention and maintain continuity. " "Feedback is subtle yet clear. Transitions are efﬁcient yet coherent.

"
"3D world.

"
"The material environment is a 3D space, which means all objects have x, y, and z " "dimensions. The z-axis is perpendicularly aligned to the plane of the display, with the " "positive z-axis extending towards the viewer. Every sheet of material occupies a single " "position along the z-axis and has a standard 1dp thickness.
" "On the web, the z-axis is used for layering and not for perspective. The 3D world is " "emulated by manipulating the y-axis.

"
"Light and shadow.

"
"Within the material environment, virtual lights illuminate the scene. Key lights create " "directional shadows, while ambient light creates soft shadows from all angles.
" "Shadows in the material environment are cast by these two light sources. In Android " "development, shadows occur when light sources are blocked by sheets of material at " "various positions along the z-axis. On the web, shadows are depicted by manipulating the " "y-axis only. The following example shows the card with a height of 6dp.

"
"Resting elevation.

"
"All material objects, regardless of size, have a resting elevation, or default elevation " "that does not change. If an object changes elevation, it should return to its resting " "elevation as soon as possible.

"
"Component elevations.

"
"The resting elevation for a component type is consistent across apps (e.g., FAB elevation " "does not vary from 6dp in one app to 16dp in another app).
" "Components may have different resting elevations across platforms, depending on the depth " "of the environment (e.g., TV has a greater depth than mobile or desktop).

"
"Responsive elevation and dynamic elevation offsets.

"
"Some component types have responsive elevation, meaning they change elevation in response " "to user input (e.g., normal, focused, and pressed) or system events. These elevation " "changes are consistently implemented using dynamic elevation offsets.
" "Dynamic elevation offsets are the goal elevation that a component moves towards, relative " "to the component’s resting state. They ensure that elevation changes are consistent " "across actions and component types. For example, all components that lift on press have " "the same elevation change relative to their resting elevation.
" "Once the input event is completed or cancelled, the component will return to its resting " "elevation.

"
"Avoiding elevation interference.

"
"Components with responsive elevations may encounter other components as they move between " "their resting elevations and dynamic elevation offsets. Because material cannot pass " "through other material, components avoid interfering with one another any number of ways, " "whether on a per component basis or using the entire app layout.
" "On a component level, components can move or be removed before they cause interference. " "For example, a floating action button (FAB) can disappear or move off screen before a " "user picks up a card, or it can move if a snackbar appears.
" "On the layout level, design your app layout to minimize opportunities for interference. " "For example, position the FAB to one side of stream of a cards so the FAB won’t interfere " "when a user tries to pick up one of cards.

"
Share
Section 1
Some informations...
Section 2
Which destination you are GOING?

This verse tells us about God\'s Eternal Plan and you are included in it. Yes! God has a wonderful plan for you. He knows your Hopes, Dreams, and all the desires of your heart because He is the one who placed it there

The Bible tells us that.. God has placed eternity in the hearts of men (Ecclesiastes 3:11). Meaning, that we are an eternal being, and that the things that can satisfy us are only things with eternal value. By knowing God\'s Eternal Plan for us is what brings real satisfaction.

Everyone has its own view of what life is, But the truth is, life is a journey that one day we are all going to reach our final Destination -- ETERNITY. The Bible is clear that we only have two destinations when our journey of life is over, we are either going to Perish in hell or have Eternal life in HEAVEN.

The problem is even though we wanted to go to heaven we cannot, because all of us have SINNED. Sin separates us from God and men have tried everything to be connected back to God but we always fall short.

He is only solution so we can change our destination from perish ti eternal life, For God so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son. Jesus took our place, became the sacrifice and died on the cross for our sin so we can be restored back to God

But God showed His great love for us by sending Christ to die for us while we were still sinners. And since we have been made right in God\'s sight by the blood of Christ. He will certainly save us from God\'s condemnation. For since our friendship with God was restored by the death of His Son while we were still His enemies, we will certainly be saved through the life of His Son

Jesus promise us that whoever believes in Him will not perish but have eternal life, We can receieve God\'s gift of salvation by placing our faith in what Jesus has done on the cross for us. To believe is to trust Jesus
For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith---and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God--not by works, so that no one can boast
• Now are you willing to surrender your sins befor God and put your faith in Jesus alone for salvation?(Prayer of Salvation)
• Have you believed and confessed Jesus as your Lord and Master of your Life?
• Are you willing to obey and follow Him for the rest of your life?

Heavenly Father... I acknowledge that because of my Sins I am separated from you.. I am sorry for my sins... and I ask you to forgive and cleanse me... I thank You that You sent You sent Your Son, Jesus to pay the penalty for my sins... Jesus I ask you to come into my heart be my Lord and Savior... I believe that you died on the cross for me... I believe that you have risen from the dead, now by faith i receive your gift of eternal life. Thank you for loving and accepting me. Help me to love, serve and obey You... for the rest of my Life... In Jesus name. Amen
Is your direction now, leading you to your destination?

The Moment you made a decision to receive God\'s gift of eternal life through Christ Jesus, your destination was change, from perish to eternal life. Now that you have a changed destination, you must have a change direction.

Walking in a wrong direction will take you somewhere but not to where you want to be, and it leads to frustraion, doubt and fear. This is also true with our spiritual lives. A step in a wrong direction is a step away from God

The problem with lost people is that they dont know that they are lost. They have no idea that every step they\'re taking is getting closer to destruction, unless they turn around(REPENT) and begin to follow Jesus.
Repent, then turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refresting may come from the Lord
Jesus declares that He is the only way, so we can return back to God. When we decide to follow His ways, it is a sure thing that we won\'t get lost again
Sometimes we are in bondage with so many lies of regrets and condemnation, saying that \"I can no longer change, I cannot experience freedom and I will not be forgiven.\"
Forgiveness and justification are received if we confess our sins. It takes a humble heart abd surrendered life to produce true repentance.\n
True Repentance(Godly Sorrow) is a personal decision of taking full responsibility and acknowledging that you have hurt God because of your Sin. \n

On the other there is also false repentance (Worldly Sorrow) it\'s feeling sorry because they are caught but not taking full responsibility, passing blame to others, always self centered -- seing themselves hurt instead God because of Sin.
Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.\n
The difference between the two is the result.
True repentance (Godly Sorrow) produces salvation and no regrets.
A false repentance(Worldly Sorrow) brings spiritual death and doesn\'t result to change lives.\n
The truth is when we follow Jesus He will bring conviction not condemnation that will lead us to true repentance and change direction

Making Jesus as your new direction leads to fullness of Life. He will take you to places you have never been before. It is going to be the most exciting journey of your life. Enjoying every step of the way to where you are going and not worrying of being in a wrong direction.\n
The thief comes only in order to steal, kill, and destroy. I have come in order that you might have life --- Life in all its fullness
• Is your life going in a new direction?
• Are there things in your life that you need to turn away from and turn back to God?
• Are there weaknesses, sins and struggles that you have surrendered but still felt condemned and need prayer to be released?
How is your Heart?

To know the condition of your heart is very important, our heart is the source of our life,\n(Proverbs 4:23 NLT) it determines the course of Life we are to live. If our heart is affected then everything around us are affected.You may have suffered a lot in your life but God is so gracious that He promise us a Change Heart is we trust in Him.
GOD FORGAVE US AND GAVE US A NEW HEART AND NEW SPIRIT

You can know that you are unconditionally loved no matter what is going on your life, whether you are accepted or rejected by others, you can know that God has completely accepted, loved and forgiven you.
I tell you the truth, all sin and blasphemy can be forgiven
\nThe only sin God can\'t Forgive, is the one you won\'t take to Him!\nSo take your broken heart to God because he alone can give you a new Heart.
WE FORGIVE OTHERS SO GOD CAN TAKE AWAY OUR STONY AND STUBBORN HEART

We are forgiven to forgive and it starts by letting go of the person who has hurt us the most. You may say it\'s unfair! You\'re right. Forgiveness isn\'t fair. It wasn\'t fair when God forgave you, and it\'s unfair for you to forgive someone else.\n\nGod doesn\'t give us what we deserve, He gives us what we need.

The Bible says God is just. One day He'll settle the score.
In the meantime, we must let God fill our hearts with peace and Grace.
The first step to forgiveness is to commit not to take justice into your own hands.\nLet go and Let God.\n

The truth is forgiveness is not for them it\'s for us. We are the ones who suffer most when we choose not to forgive but when we do forgive, the Lord sets our hearts free from the anger, bitterness, resentment and hurt that previously improsoned us.\n
When we forgive, you set a prisoner free, but you discover that the real prisoner is yourself.\n
Would you allow the Lord to take away your stony and stubnorn heart and give you a new heart today?
FORGIVE YOURSELF AND RECEIVE A TENDER AND RESPONSIVE HEART
There is one more person you need to forgive and I believe the most important one, that\'s YOU.\n

Sometimes your own self is the hardest to forgive, you can\'t easily let go of the past and you live in pain and regret. If you do this, you will lose your self worth and will have a wrong image of yourself. You will have a hardtime trusting people, trusting yourself and above all trusting God.\nWho you are is affected on the condition of your heart.\n

But you can change all that, by reversing the way you see yourself and start seeing the way God sees. If God has forgiven you, you must start forgiving yourself.\nYou are not greater than God that you cannot forgive yourself.\n
Forgiving yourself brings healing to your self-image and changes your heart into a tender and responsive heart to follow His will.
• Have you received God\'s forgiveness in your life?
• Are there pains in your heart that were caused by people or yourself that you are carrying right now?
• Do you want to be a free and release a prayer of forgiveness to them and to yourself?
How\'s your Relationship with God

A lot of people only see Jesus as religion but never experienced a personal relationship with Him.\nI believe it\'s about time to change. It\'s time to change religion into RELATION, because Jesus is not interested in our religion.\nHe is interested in our relationship with Him.
\nThe Moment you accepted Jesus as your personal Lord and Savior, you begun a relationship that will continue to last forever.
\nHow\'s your Relationship with God?
BE ROOTED - LORDSHIP IS MAKING HIM NUMBER ONE

In order to contine following Jesus you must let your roots grow down into Him by acknowledging His Lordship over your lives. Like a tree that depends its life on the roots, so as salvation begins by confessing that Jesus is Lord.\n
That if you confess with your mouth, \"Jesus is Lord,\" and believe and your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you will be saved.\n

Lordship simply means \"Number One\". Confessing Him as your Lord is making Him the number one and top priority of your life. It\'s all about coming into a complete surrender and security taht He knows what\'s best for you.
\nA tree without roots is a tree without Life. Jesus must become root of our life, for without Him we are nothing.
BE BUILT ON HIM - LORDSHIP IS LIVING A LIFE OF OBEDIENCE

Salvation is what Christ has done for us but Lordship is what we can do for Him. Apostle Paul taught us that the next thing we must do is to let your lives be built on Him. We can do this by living a life of obedience to His Word.\n
Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock.\n

Lordship demands our obedience, Christ must be the supreme authority of our lives to the point that it\'s not our will but His will be done. As we do this we are building our lives on unshakeable foundation, no storms and waves of this life can destroy us because we are founded on the solid rock.
BE FAITHFUL - HIS LORDSHIP IN YOUR LIFE WILL BE TESTED, STAY FAITHFUL

When we follow God\'s will, it comes being faithful (then your faith will grow strong in the truth v.7b)... our faith will always be be tested. Temptation and distractions may come but when you know who the ruler of your life is, it\'s easy to stay faithful. It\'s easy to know that this is just a test. If you know that you belong to God you will have confidence that He knows what\'s best and will remain faithful to Him.\n
To the faithful you show yourself faithful;\n

But if you don\'t stay and faithful and follow the distraction, that path will lead you to a world of fear and unbelief. All because you have allowed something else to rule you. In doing that, you are not living God\s will for your life and you will not reap the benefits of His blessings.\n
Many are the blessings of a faithful man and an evil one will not be spared in His evil.\n
Blessings are waiting for the faithful ones and it can be yours too.
BE THANKFUL - LORDSHIP STARTS FROM OUR THANKFUL HEART

Lordship can bring us a sense of security and joy that will result to (overflow with thankfulness v.7b). This is the difference between religion and relationship. We follow Jesus, not because we have to but because we want to. It\'s willingness of the heart and not about folling as a set of religion and traditional it\'s a personal thing that starts from our thankful heart.\n
I give thanks to you, O Lord my God, with my whole heart, and I will glorify your name forever.\n
Serving God is never boring; It\'s full of fun and surprises. The greatest decision you have made in your life is the time you have fully surrendered and submitted to His Lordship.
• Are there areas in your Life that you need to submit to His Lordship?
• Are you willing to make Him the number one in your Life?
• Are you willing to lay down your will and let His will be done in your life through prayer?
God will use these four things to developed us by changing our lives

God is excited about His wonderful plan for your life. But before you can experience that there should be a change in us. In the bible Jesus chose ordinary men and changed them into world changers. How exciting it is to know that God\'s plan is not just to change us but to change others through us -- Changed to Change others!\n

Change requires devotion. As the early believers devoted themselves to PRAYER, SHARING, FELLOWSHIP, and TEACHING, making these as their lifestyle it resulted to changed lives and changing the world.\n
God will use these four things to developed us by changing our lives.
DEVOTIONAL LIFE - Prayer

Just as good friends talk to each other, so God your heavenly Father, wants you to talk to Him. And while you may not understand it right now, you'll find that He "talks" to you through His word -- the Bible. 

You can pray to God about anything and everything. He wants to hear from you.
Don\'t worry about anything; instead, pray about everything. Tell God what you need, and thank Him for all he has done.\n
Pick a time of the day where you can just be with God in prayer and reading His Word. You will discover how He loves you so much and His plans and purpose for your life.
LIFE GROUP - Sharing
God doesn\'t want us to take this journey of life alone that is why He gives us family and friends to be there for us. \n

Life Group is your spiritual family where you can receive encouragement, acceptance and love. Just like family, there is someone that will become your spiritual parents to give you care, guidance ad would bring out the best in you.
CHURCH - Fellowship

Church is not a building as we think it is, but the Bible tells us that it\'s a group people that loves God. Church is not a place you go to but a family you belong to. You belong to this greatest family when you became a Christian; you have joined a family -- sometimes called \"the body of Christ\", which means you are now "related" to Christian all over the world!\n
You need to join a portion of that famiy by beginning to attend a local church, You need a church to help you continue to grow and for you to fulfill your purpose in life.\n
And let us not neglect our meeting together, as some people do, but encourage one another, especially now that the day of his return is drawing near.
EQUIPPING -Teaching
Finally, we need to be trained and equipped for us to become effective on what God wants us to do.\n

God wants to use you to change many lives but He has to start that change within you. Because if you change everything changes. He wants to bring out the best in you by allowing you to go through the equipping process.\n
In this process you will experience FIRE, FREEDOM AND FOCUS! You will encounter God in a way that you will have never experience before. \n
Encounter is a 3 days retreat that will lead you to discover everything that God has for you.\n
There is so much in you that you need to discover, if you would allow God and me to help you, it would be my greatest joy to accept you as one of my disciples.
•Would you allow me to teach you how to establish your prayer life?
•Would you be willing to be part of a life group?
•Would you be willing to join the retreat in the next schedule?
•Can you make a short and simple prayer to Jesus thanking Him for bringing a change in you and to help you see the things that to be changed in your life.
